about.name: Istanbul
about.info_text: Istanbul, formerly known as Byzantium and Constantinople, is a city that straddles Europe and Asia across the Bosphorus Strait. It has a rich and diverse history that spans over 2,000 years, making it a city of incredible cultural and historical significance. Istanbul is renowned for its stunning architecture, including the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque, its bustling bazaars, and its unique blend of Eastern and Western influences. Visitors to Istanbul can explore its vibrant neighborhoods, sample delicious Turkish cuisine, and immerse themselves in its unique atmosphere.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 15.5 million
Country: Turkey
Time Zone: Turkey Time (UTC+03:00)
Language: Turkish
Currency: Turkish Lira (TRY)
about.climate_text: Istanbul experiences a temperate Mediterranean climate, with hot and dry summers and mild, wet winters. The best times to visit are in spring and autumn when the weather is pleasant.

attractions_card.title: Hagia Sophia
attractions_card.description: The Hagia Sophia is an architectural marvel that has served as a church, mosque, and museum. It features stunning mosaics and a unique blend of Byzantine and Islamic architecture.

attractions_card.title: Blue Mosque
attractions_card.description: The Blue Mosque, also known as Sultan Ahmed Mosque, is famous for its impressive blue tiles and intricate design. It's a masterpiece of Ottoman architecture.

attractions_card.title: Topkapi Palace
attractions_card.description: Topkapi Palace was the primary residence of Ottoman sultans for centuries. It's a vast complex with beautiful courtyards, stunning chambers, and a rich history.

attractions_card.title: Grand Bazaar
attractions_card.description: The Grand Bazaar is one of the world's oldest and largest covered markets, offering a vast array of shops selling textiles, ceramics, jewelry, spices, and more.

attractions_card.title: Bosphorus Cruise
attractions_card.description: A Bosphorus cruise allows you to witness Istanbul's breathtaking skyline, including the Dolmabahçe Palace and historic waterfront mansions.

attractions_card.title: Süleymaniye Mosque
attractions_card.description: The Süleymaniye Mosque is a masterpiece of Ottoman architecture, known for its grand dome and serene courtyards with stunning views of the city.

attractions_card.title: Basilica Cistern
attractions_card.description: The Basilica Cistern is an underground wonder with rows of ancient columns submerged in water, providing a mysterious and unique atmosphere.

attractions_card.title: Chora Church
attractions_card.description: The Chora Church, or Kariye Museum, is famous for its remarkable mosaics and frescoes that depict scenes from the life of Christ.

food_card.title: Kebabs
food_card.description: Turkish kebabs are a culinary delight, featuring marinated and grilled meat, often served with pita bread, vegetables, and flavorful sauces.

food_card.title: Baklava
food_card.description: Baklava is a sweet dessert made of layers of filo pastry, honey, and nuts. It's a popular treat and a must-try in Istanbul.

food_card.title: Turkish Delight
food_card.description: Turkish Delight, known as lokum, is a delightful confection made from starch and sugar, often flavored with rosewater or various fruits and nuts.

food_card.title: Manti
food_card.description: Manti are Turkish dumplings filled with ground meat or vegetables, topped with yogurt and a drizzle of garlic-infused butter.

food_card.title: Iskender Kebab
food_card.description: Iskender Kebab is a delicious dish of sliced doner kebab meat served over pita bread, topped with tomato sauce and yogurt.

hotels_card.alt: Four Seasons Hotel Istanbul at Sultanahmet
hotels_card.title: Four Seasons Hotel Istanbul at Sultanahmet
hotels_card.description: This luxurious hotel is located in the heart of the historic Sultanahmet district, offering elegant rooms and stunning views of Hagia Sophia.

hotels_card.title: Pera Palace Hotel, Jumeirah
hotels_card.description: Pera Palace is a historic hotel that has hosted numerous famous guests. It combines timeless elegance with modern amenities.

hotels_card.title: The Marmara Taksim
hotels_card.description: The Marmara Taksim offers comfortable accommodations with panoramic views of the Bosphorus and the city, located in the vibrant Taksim Square.

hotels_card.title: Swissotel The Bosphorus Istanbul
hotels_card.description: This luxury hotel provides a prime location on the Bosphorus waterfront and features spacious rooms, a spa, and fine dining options.

hotels_card.title: Hotel Amira Istanbul
hotels_card.description: Hotel Amira offers cozy accommodations in Sultanahmet, within walking distance of major attractions like the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque.

transport_card.title: Istanbul Metro
transport_card.description: The Istanbul Metro is a convenient way to navigate the city, connecting various neighborhoods and attractions.

transport_card.title: Trams
transport_card.description: Trams are a common mode of public transportation in Istanbul, serving both the historic and modern parts of the city.

transport_card.title: Ferries
transport_card.description: Ferries are a scenic way to travel between the European and Asian sides of Istanbul, offering breathtaking views of the Bosphorus.

transport_card.title: Taxis
transport_card.description: Taxis are readily available in Istanbul and can be hailed on the street or booked through ride-sharing apps.
